SITâ€™s Public Statement
The Bachelor of Food Technology with Honours will be offered as an SIT -conferred degree
programme with effect from AY2024*. The programme  will replace the SIT -Massey University
Bachelor of Food Technology with Honours joint degree programme.
SIT and Massey University decided to cease the joint degree programme with the last intake in
AY2023, as part of the regular review process. This cess ation will not affect current students or
alumni. Both Universities are committed to ensuring that the quality of teaching remains of a
high standard until the final batch of students graduate in 2027. The joint degree will continue to
be recognised in Sin gapore and beyond.
We thank Massey University for a strong and fruitful collaboration, and we will continue to
prepare graduates to be innovators and agents of change in the food industry. Massey and SIT
will continue to collaborate on food science resear ch and explore other ways to continue our
connections, support our food industries, and share knowledge for the mutual benefit of our
countries, university staff and students.
*Holders of articulated diplomas will be eligible for direct entry to Year 2 of  the programme in
the AY2024 intake. Articulated diplomas are: Food Science and Nutrition (NYP), Food Science and
Technology (SP), and Food, Nutrition & Culinary Science (TP; formerly Applied Food Science and
Nutrition).
Holders of non -articulated diplomas , A level, International Baccalaureate diploma, and other
equivalent Year 12 qualifications may apply for admission to the programme from the AY2025
intake.
